\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions:module-ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions:ifa-smeargle-analysis-base-functions-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions}\spxextra{module}}
This is where common functions to all of the analysis
code is written to.
\index{create\_directory\_analysis\_files() (in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions)@\spxentry{create\_directory\_analysis\_files()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions:ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions.create_directory_analysis_files}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_directory\_analysis\_files}}}{\emph{data\_directory}, \emph{mask\_file}, \emph{filter\_directory}, \emph{filter\_config\_file}, \emph{analysis\_function}, \emph{analysis\_parameters}, \emph{run}, \emph{append=False}}{}
This function is the common function to compute and save the
results of analysis functions.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The data directory by which all of data for the analysis
is contained within.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{mask\_file}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The mask, if desired, that will be applied to this analysis
run.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The directory that has all of the synthesized filter files.
If it does not exist, then the filters will be calculated if
possible.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_config\_file}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The configuration file with the filtering parameters. This
is used if only the filter is calculated rather than read.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{analysis\_function}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{function}}) \textendash{} The analysis function that will be used to calculate the
analysis results.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{analysis\_parameters}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}) \textendash{} The dictionary for the arguments of the analysis function.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{run}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} This is a flag to ensure that the analysis script should run.
If it is False, it is not run.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{append}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} This parameter specifies what to do with a file conflict.
If True, the new analysis is appended to the other header;
else, an exception is raised. Defaults to False.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
None

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_filter\_from\_configuration() (in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions)@\spxentry{create\_filter\_from\_configuration()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions:ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions.create_filter_from_configuration}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_filter\_from\_configuration}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{filter\_config}}{}
This function applies all of the filters that are written based
on the configurations supplied.

All filters are obtained automatically from the written code.
If required configuration parameters are missing for any of the
filters, they are automatically skipped.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The data array by which the filters will be calculated from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_config}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ConfigObj}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary\sphinxhyphen{}like}}) \textendash{} The configuration that the filters will use.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{filter\_array} \textendash{} The filter, made of each of the individual filters as
calculated.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_filter\_from\_directory() (in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions)@\spxentry{create\_filter\_from\_directory()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions:ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions.create_filter_from_directory}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_filter\_from\_directory}}}{\emph{data\_file}, \emph{filter\_directory}}{}
This function extracts the filter from a filter directory that
corresponds to the data file.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_file}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The name of the data file that is going to used as the
reference to find any matching filter files. All directory
information is stripped.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{filter\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The directory by which the filters within will be checked if
they match to the data file.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{filter\_array} \textendash{} The filter, made of each of the individual filters as
calculated.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_analysis\_fits\_filenames() (in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions)@\spxentry{get\_analysis\_fits\_filenames()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions:ifa_smeargle.analysis.base_functions.get_analysis_fits_filenames}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.base\_functions.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_analysis\_fits\_filenames}}}{\emph{data\_directory}, \emph{recursive=False}}{}
This function is to obtain all of the filter fits files
within the directory provided. Mask fits files are those that
have the extension \sphinxtitleref{.analysis.fits}.

In general, this is a wrapper function around the normal
fits file glob function adapted for filters.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The data directory that the filter fits files will be
searched from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{recursive}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} If True, also search subdirectories for filter fits files.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{analysis\_fits\_filenames} \textendash{} The list of the analysis fits file names.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.heatmap module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.heatmap:module-ifa_smeargle.analysis.heatmap}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.heatmap:ifa-smeargle-analysis-heatmap-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.heatmap::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.heatmap (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.heatmap}\spxextra{module}}
This function computes all of the heat\sphinxhyphen{}map information needed for
plotting.
\index{analysis\_heatmap() (in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.heatmap)@\spxentry{analysis\_heatmap()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.heatmap}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.analysis.heatmap:ifa_smeargle.analysis.heatmap.analysis_heatmap}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.analysis.heatmap.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{analysis\_heatmap}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{mask\_filter=None}, \emph{run=True}}{}
This generates the dictionary which is the results from the
analysis of the data to create a heat\sphinxhyphen{}map of the data.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The array of data that will be used to compute the heat\sphinxhyphen{}map
results.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{mask\_filter}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The array of mask and filter values to consider in the
calculations. True values denote the mask/filter is applied,
False otherwise.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{run}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} If True, the analysis is run, else it is not and will exit
with None.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{heatmap\_results} \textendash{} The results of the heat\sphinxhyphen{}map analysis.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
dictionary

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{script\_analysis\_heatmap() (in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.heatmap)@\spxentry{script\_analysis\_heatmap()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.analysis.heatmap}}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.configuration:module-ifa_smeargle.core.configuration}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.configuration:ifa-smeargle-core-configuration-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.configuration::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration}\spxextra{module}}
This contains the common functions dedicated to the reading,
writing, and validating of configuration files.
\index{copy\_configuration\_file() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration)@\spxentry{copy\_configuration\_file()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.configuration:ifa_smeargle.core.configuration.copy_configuration_file}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{copy\_configuration\_file}}}{\emph{config\_type}, \emph{destination}, \emph{file\_name=None}}{}
This function finds a configuration file based on the
configuration type, and copies it directly into the destination
directory. If the configuration file doesn’t not exist within
the library, an exception is raised.

Simple substring testing is used to check if the configuration
type matches.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{config\_type}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The type of configuration file that can be copied.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{destination}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The destination directory for the configuration file type
copy.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} This is an optional file name. The extension .ini will be
added unless it is already present. No directory information
should be provided here. Defaults to the copied file name.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{config\_path} \textendash{} The new path that the configuration can be found at.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
string

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{extract\_configuration() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration)@\spxentry{extract\_configuration()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.configuration:ifa_smeargle.core.configuration.extract_configuration}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{extract\_configuration}}}{\emph{config\_object}, \emph{keys}}{}
This is a wrapper to obtain the configuration parameter from
the configuration tag. This function includes proper error
handling.

\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{config\_object}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ConfigObj}}) \textendash{} The configuration object that is going to be tested.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{keys}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} The keys that should be called, in order.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{value} \textendash{} The value that the keys was containing.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{read\_configuration\_file() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration)@\spxentry{read\_configuration\_file()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.configuration:ifa_smeargle.core.configuration.read_configuration_file}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.configuration.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{read\_configuration\_file}}}{\emph{config\_file\_name}, \emph{specification\_file\_name}}{}
This reads in a configuration file name specified by the
ConfigObj module. Verification is required.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{config\_file\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The path and file name of the configuration. If None, then
the defaults are returned.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{specification\_file\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The path and file name of the specification/validation file.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{configuration} \textendash{} The configuration according to the specification and
configuration files.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ConfigObj

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.core.error module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:module-ifa_smeargle.core.error}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa-smeargle-core-error-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.core.error (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.core.error}\spxextra{module}}
Defining custom errors because Python does not have all of the
needed error categories.
\index{AssumptionError@\spxentry{AssumptionError}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.AssumptionError}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{AssumptionError}}}{\emph{message=None}}{}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.Ifas_BaseException}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.Ifas\_BaseException}}}}}

This error is reserved for instances where something
unexpected has occurred because of a flaw in the understanding
of assumptions about Python or module functions.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{BrokenLogicError@\spxentry{BrokenLogicError}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.BrokenLogicError}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{BrokenLogicError}}}{\emph{message=None}}{}

This error is encountered when the program enters in a place it
should not be able to. Incorporated mostly for safety; usually
not the fault of the user.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{ConfigurationError@\spxentry{ConfigurationError}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

configuration processing (usually because the configuration
class is incorrect).

\index{ConfigurationWarning@\spxentry{ConfigurationWarning}}

equivalent function. This is mostly used for cases where a

\index{DeprecatedWarning@\spxentry{DeprecatedWarning}}

\index{DevelopmentError@\spxentry{DevelopmentError}}

\index{ImprecisionError@\spxentry{ImprecisionError}}

\index{MagicError@\spxentry{MagicError}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.MagicError}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{MagicError}}}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.Ifas_Exception}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.Ifas\_Exception}}}}}

This error is used when any routine would utilize
magic/hard\sphinxhyphen{}coded values for the purposes of any process where
said numbers are magic. This is mostly as a programming warning
to the user that behavior with magic numbers may not always be
expected or logical. This error form is used for higher warning
levels, and if the user wants an interrupt when upgrading.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{MagicWarning@\spxentry{MagicWarning}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.MagicWarning}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{MagicWarning}}}

This warning is used when any routine would utilize
magic/hard\sphinxhyphen{}coded values for the purposes of any process where
said numbers are magic. This is mostly as a programming
warning to the user that behavior with magic numbers may not
always be expected or logical.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{MaskingError@\spxentry{MaskingError}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.MaskingError}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{MaskingError}}}

are fatal issues with calculating the mask.

\index{MaskingWarning@\spxentry{MaskingWarning}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.MaskingWarning}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{MaskingWarning}}}

This warning is used when any masking or filtering routine
(especially in the masking and filtering scripts) fails to
mask any pixels or something else is amiss. It is not a bad
thing, but it can be helpful to know.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{MemoryWarning@\spxentry{MemoryWarning}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.MemoryWarning}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{MemoryWarning}}}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.Ifas_Warning}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.Ifas\_Warning}}}}}

This warning is used to warn the user that the procedures that
follow would require a lot of memory RAM. If instead it would
produce a large file(s), StorageWarning should be used.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{ModelingError@\spxentry{ModelingError}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.ModelingError}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ModelingError}}}

This error is used when there are issues with applying or
fitting models to a particular set of data. May be used
hand\sphinxhyphen{}in\sphinxhyphen{}hand with DataError.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{OverwriteWarning@\spxentry{OverwriteWarning}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.OverwriteWarning}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{OverwriteWarning}}}
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.Ifas_Warning}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.Ifas\_Warning}}}}}

This warning is used to warn the user that a file has been
overwritten, most likely because of conflicting file names.

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{ReductionWarning@\spxentry{ReductionWarning}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.error:ifa_smeargle.core.error.ReductionWarning}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{exception }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.error.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ReductionWarning}}}

This warning is used when normally unusual parameters are
used for data reduction. The user is trusted in their procedures.

\index{StorageWarning@\spxentry{StorageWarning}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

to the hard drive. If instead a lot of RAM would be used, it is

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.core.io module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.io:module-ifa_smeargle.core.io}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.io:ifa-smeargle-core-io-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.io::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.core.io (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.core.io}\spxextra{module}}
These are functions related to the reading, writing, and
manipulation of files (data, configuration, or otherwise).
\index{append\_astropy\_header\_card() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io)@\spxentry{append\_astropy\_header\_card()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.io:ifa_smeargle.core.io.append_astropy_header_card}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.io.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{append\_astropy\_header\_card}}}{\emph{file\_name}, \emph{header\_cards}, \emph{comment\_cards=None}}{}
This is a function to add header card entries into the
header of a fits file. This uses dictionaries to achieve said
result.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} This is the path of the file to be written, either relative
or absolute.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{header\_cards}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}) \textendash{} The header entries to be added to the header file. Please
note that the keys of the dictionary must be no more than
8 characters; otherwise a HIERARCH card will be used.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{comment\_cards}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The comment entries to be added to the header file. The
keys of the comment dictionary and the \sphinxtitleref{header\_cards} must
line up.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{hdul\_file} \textendash{} The file object that was written to disk. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{hdu\_object}}
was provided, it is returned with its header changed.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Astropy PrimaryHDU

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{archive\_data\_directory() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io)@\spxentry{archive\_data\_directory()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.io:ifa_smeargle.core.io.archive_data_directory}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.io.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{archive\_data\_directory}}}{\emph{data\_directory}, \emph{archive\_name=None}, \emph{archive\_type=\textquotesingle{}bztar\textquotesingle{}}, \emph{silent=False}}{}
Creates a file archive of a copy of the data files contained
within a directory.

This function creates an archive of a data directory, preserving
a copy of data. However, note that this function generally takes
a bit of time if there are a lot of files or if the files are
particularly large.

Please note that this function archives recursively. Non\sphinxhyphen{}data
files and non\sphinxhyphen{}required files should not be in the a given
data/archiving directory.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The directory that the data is contained within.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{archive\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The name of the archive that is to be created. If not
provided, a default is provided that contains the time\sphinxhyphen{}stamp
of its creation.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{archive\_extension}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The extension of the archive. Note that only some archives
are supported. Default is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bztar}}. See
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{shutil.get\_archive\_formats()}} for more information on
available archive formats.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{silent}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} Turn off all warnings and information sent by this function
and functions below it.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{archive\_path} \textendash{} The path of the archive file.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
string

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{dearchive\_data\_directory() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io)@\spxentry{dearchive\_data\_directory()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.io:ifa_smeargle.core.io.dearchive_data_directory}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.io.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{dearchive\_data\_directory}}}{\emph{archive\_name}, \emph{alternate\_directory=None}, \emph{silent=False}}{}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{silent}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} Turn off all warnings and information sent by this function

\index{get\_fits\_filenames() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io)@\spxentry{get\_fits\_filenames()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.io:ifa_smeargle.core.io.get_fits_filenames}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.io.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_fits\_filenames}}}{\emph{data\_directory}, \emph{sub\_extension=None}, \emph{recursive=False}}{}
This function is a wrapper function around the glob command
to get all fits files.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The data directory that the fits files will be search for
from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sub\_extension}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} This allows for the focus of obtaining fits files that
is only like a .subextension.fits file, depending on what
the string \sphinxtitleref{sub\sphinxhyphen{}extension} is.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{recursive}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} If True, also search subdirectories for fits files.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{fits\_filenames} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{list}) \textendash{} The list of the fits file names.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleemphasis{.. note::} \textendash{} If \sphinxtitleref{data\_directory} is instead a valid fit file, then only
that fit file is returned in a list. This allows scripts to
only be run on single files. (Recursive must be False.)

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

A function to ensure proper loading/reading of fits files.

This function, as its name, opens a fits file. It returns the
Astropy HDU file. This function is mostly done to ensure that
files are properly closed. It also extracts the needed data
and header information from the file.

structure.

\item {}

string blank for all files.

to be renamed. Does not handle directories recursively.

\index{write\_fits\_file() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io)@\spxentry{write\_fits\_file()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.io}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

A function to ensure proper writing of fits files.

This function writes fits files given the data and header file.
The file name should be a complete path and must also include
the file name.

priority to be written, the rest are ignored.

\item {}

overwrite.

\item {}

and functions below it.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{hdul\_file} \textendash{} The file object that was written to disk. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{hdu\_object}}
was provided, it is returned untouched.

Astropy HDUList

\end{description}\end{quote}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.core.magic module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.magic:module-ifa_smeargle.core.magic}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.magic:ifa-smeargle-core-magic-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.magic::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.core.magic (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.core.magic}\spxextra{module}}
This is to hold functions that are pure ‘magic’. That is, functions
that perform what they are supposed to do, but, are fragile because
their operations are not defined by conventional understanding, but
instead as “it works, I don’t know why, but it does”.
\index{magic\_inital\_gaussian\_parameters() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.magic)@\spxentry{magic\_inital\_gaussian\_parameters()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.magic}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.magic:ifa_smeargle.core.magic.magic_inital_gaussian_parameters}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.magic.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{magic\_inital\_gaussian\_parameters}}}{\emph{x\_data}, \emph{y\_data}}{}
This is a magic program to derive the guesses of Gaussian fit
parameters from an array of values.

\end{fulllineitems}



\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics:module-ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics:ifa-smeargle-core-mathematics-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics}\spxextra{module}}\index{generate\_numpy\_bin\_width\_array() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics)@\spxentry{generate\_numpy\_bin\_width\_array()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics:ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics.generate_numpy_bin_width_array}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{generate\_numpy\_bin\_width\_array}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{bin\_width}, \emph{local\_minimum=None}, \emph{local\_maximum=None}}{}
Matplotlib does not support having input bin withs; this
returns a valid form.

This function just generates a valid bin value list provided a
given bin widths. If the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{local\_maximum}} or
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{local\_minimum value}} is not provided, then the absolute
maximum and minimum of the provided array is used.

If mod{[}(max \sphinxhyphen{} min), bin\_width{]} != 0, the last/highest bin is
disenfranchised. This function can adapt to masked arrays.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The data to which the bins will be calculated from;
ignored if the two local maximum and minimum parameters are
provided.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{bin\_width}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The width of the bins.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{local\_minimum}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} A predefined minimum that the calculating function
should use.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{local\_maximum}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} A predefined maximum that the calculating function
should use.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{bin\_list\_values} \textendash{} A list of values that can be fed into matplotlib to emulate
binning by a value width.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{generate\_prime\_numbers() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics)@\spxentry{generate\_prime\_numbers()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics:ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics.generate_prime_numbers}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{generate\_prime\_numbers}}}{\emph{index}, \emph{count=1}}{}
This function returns prime numbers from a downloaded list
provided by OEIS.

This function returns the prime number at the 0\sphinxhyphen{}indexed
location (e.g. 0 index is 2, 1 index is 3, etc.). It will
also return the \sphinxtitleref{count} number of prime numbers including and
including the prime number at the specified index.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{index}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The 0\sphinxhyphen{}indexed index for the prime number to start at. If it
is negative, the prime numbers will be randomized from
2 to 104729 (the first and last prime numbers in the list).

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{count}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The number of prime numbers that will be returned. It must
be greater than 1.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{prime\_array} \textendash{} The prime numbers. The numbers are sorted.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
array

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{ifas\_large\_integer\_array\_product() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics)@\spxentry{ifas\_large\_integer\_array\_product()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics:ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics.ifas_large_integer_array_product}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ifas\_large\_integer\_array\_product}}}{\emph{integer\_array}}{}
Arrays of large integer numbers, or large integer results,
do not operate as well with multiplication.

The purpose of this function is to compute the product of the
integer as accurately as possible without error. The main source
of error is over/underflow and precision error from the lack of
byte allocation.

If the numbers are not integers, they will be forced into
integers.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{integer\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\sphinxhyphen{}like}}) \textendash{} The array of integers that will be multiplied.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{product} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{integer}) \textendash{} The product of the entire array.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{ln\_product} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} The natural log of the product to a high precision.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{log10\_product} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} The base 10 log of the product to a high precision.

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{ifas\_masked\_mean() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics)@\spxentry{ifas\_masked\_mean()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics}}

valid data.

There are outstanding problems with how the masked arrays
handle means. For some reason, there is no np.ma.nanmean
function. This adds that functionality.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
float or ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics:ifa_smeargle.core.mathematics.ifas_robust_mean}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.mathematics.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ifas\_robust\_mean}}}{\emph{array}}{}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.core.modeling module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.modeling:module-ifa_smeargle.core.modeling}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.modeling:ifa-smeargle-core-modeling-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.modeling::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.core.modeling (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.core.modeling}\spxextra{module}}
This module contains functions that are strictly the backbone of many
of the modeling and fitting functionality.
\index{fit\_gaussian\_function() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.modeling)@\spxentry{fit\_gaussian\_function()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.modeling}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.modeling:ifa_smeargle.core.modeling.fit_gaussian_function}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.modeling.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{fit\_gaussian\_function}}}{\emph{x\_data}, \emph{y\_data}, \emph{inital\_guesses}}{}
This function fits a Gaussian function to a specific set of
data.

Gaussian fitting is hard, this function exists as a port so that
all fitting functions use the same algorithm and said algorithm
is easy to change.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{x\_data}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The X data that the Gaussian will be fit over.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{y\_data}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The Y data that the Gaussian will be fit over.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{inital\_guesses}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}) \textendash{} 
Initial guesses for the Gaussian fitting function. The
allowed inputs and their keys are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’mean’}] \leavevmode{[}The initial guess of the Gaussian function’s{]}
mean. Defaults to 0.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’studded’}] \leavevmode{[}The initial guess of the Gaussian{]}
function’s standard deviation.
Defaults to 1.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’amplitude’}] \leavevmode{[}The initial guess of the Gaussian{]}
function’s  amplitude. Defaults to 1.

\end{description}

\end{itemize}


\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{gaussian\_function} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{function}) \textendash{} A callable function that when provided an X value, it
will return the value of the function.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{gaussian\_parameters} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{dictionary}) \textendash{} A compiled dictionary of all of the parameters of the
Gaussian fit.

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{fit\_histogram\_gaussian\_function() (in module ifa\_smeargle.core.modeling)@\spxentry{fit\_histogram\_gaussian\_function()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.core.modeling}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core.modeling:ifa_smeargle.core.modeling.fit_histogram_gaussian_function}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.core.modeling.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{fit\_histogram\_gaussian\_function}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{bin\_width}}{}

of data.

Gaussian fitting is hard, this function exists as a port so that
all fitting functions use the same algorithm and said algorithm
is easy to change. This applies it to the histogram of the data.

\item {}

function.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{gaussian\_function} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{function}) \textendash{} A callable function that when provided an X value, it will
return the value of the function.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{gaussian\_parameters} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{dictionary}) \textendash{} A compiled dictionary of all of the parameters of the
Gaussian fit.

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\paragraph{Module contents}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core:module-ifa_smeargle.core}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.core:module-contents}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.core (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.core}\spxextra{module}}
This module is dedicated to holding core or common functions to all
other modules related to the IfA\sphinxhyphen{}Smeargle library.

In general, these should not be used to manipulate data from
a pipeline script directly.


\subsubsection{ifa\_smeargle.masking package}

\index{get\_filter\_fits\_filenames() (in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.base\_functions)@\spxentry{get\_filter\_fits\_filenames()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.base\_functions}}

This function is to obtain all of the filter fits files
within the directory provided. Mask fits files are those that
have the extension \sphinxtitleref{.filter.fits}.

In general, this is a wrapper function around the normal
fits file glob function adapted for filters.

\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}

\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The data directory that the filter fits files will be

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{recursive}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} If True, also search subdirectories for filter fits files.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{filter\_fits\_filenames} \textendash{} The list of the filter fits file names.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

extension \sphinxtitleref{.mask.fits}.

In general, this is a wrapper function around the normal
fits file glob function adapted for masks.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The data directory that the mask fits files will be search
from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{recursive}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} If True, also search subdirectories for mask fits files.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{mask\_fits\_filenames} \textendash{} The list of the mask fits file names.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{synthesize\_masks() (in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.base\_functions)@\spxentry{synthesize\_masks()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.base\_functions}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking.base_functions:ifa_smeargle.masking.base_functions.synthesize_masks}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.masking.base\_functions.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{synthesize\_masks}}}{\emph{*args}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
This is a function to combine many masks into one single
mask.This argument does not take any keyword arguments. All of
the masks must be the same size. (In general, the first mask is
considered the correct mask.)

\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{**kwargs}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}) \textendash{} This catches any keyword arguments sent through.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{synthesized\_mask} \textendash{} The combined mask made of all of the inputted masks.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
array

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking.filters:module-ifa_smeargle.masking.filters}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking.filters:ifa-smeargle-masking-filters-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking.filters::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters}\spxextra{module}}
This contains all of the value based filters when doing analysis.
\index{filter\_exact\_value() (in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters)@\spxentry{filter\_exact\_value()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking.filters:ifa_smeargle.masking.filters.filter_exact_value}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{filter\_exact\_value}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{exact\_value}}{}
This function computes a filter for all pixel values
equal to some exact value.

Float equality comparisons are dependent on tolerances. The main
back function used is \sphinxtitleref{numpy.isclose}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The data array that the filter will be calculated from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{exact\_value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The value that data values close will be tagged as filtered.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{final\_filter} \textendash{} The filter as computed by this function.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{filter\_invalid\_value() (in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters)@\spxentry{filter\_invalid\_value()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking.filters:ifa_smeargle.masking.filters.filter_invalid_value}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{filter\_invalid\_value}}}{\emph{data\_array}}{}
This filter applies a mask to all numerically invalid inputs
on a programing side.

Numbers that are usually infinite or some other nonsensical
quantity serve no real usage in calculations further downstream.
Therefore, they are masked here.

See numpy.ma.fix\_invalid for what is considered invalid.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The data array that the mask will be calculated from.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{final\_mask} \textendash{} A boolean array for pixels that are masked (True) or are
valid (False).

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} dictionary

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{filter\_percent\_truncation() (in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters)@\spxentry{filter\_percent\_truncation()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking.filters:ifa_smeargle.masking.filters.filter_percent_truncation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{filter\_percent\_truncation}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{top\_percent}, \emph{bottom\_percent}}{}
This filter truncates the top and bottom percent of pixels
provided.

The values \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{top\_percent}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bottom\_percent}} notate the
percentage of pixels from top and bottom of the data array
(in value) that should be filtered. The pixels masked are
independent on the previous masks applied.

If the percentage of pixels leads to a non\sphinxhyphen{}integer number of
pixels to be masked, the number is floored. All pixels that have
a same value as the limiting pixel value for the top and bottom
percent of pixels are also masked.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The data array that the filter will be calculated from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{top\_count}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The percent of pixels from the top (highest value) of
the array that is to be masked.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{bottom\_count}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The percent of pixels from the bottom (lowest value) of
the array that is to be masked.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{final\_filter} \textendash{} The filter as computed by this function.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

The values \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{top\_count}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bottom\_count}} notate the number

\index{filter\_sigma\_value() (in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters)@\spxentry{filter\_sigma\_value()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking.filters:ifa_smeargle.masking.filters.filter_sigma_value}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.masking.filters.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{filter\_sigma\_value}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{sigma\_multiple}, \emph{sigma\_iterations=1}}{}
This applies a mask on pixels outside a given multiple of a sigma
value.

This function masks values if they are outsize of a sigma range
from the mean. The mean and sigma values are automatically
calculated from the array provided.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The data array that the mask will be calculated from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sigma\_multiple}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\sphinxhyphen{}like}}) \textendash{} The multiple of sigma which will be applied. Unequal
bottom\sphinxhyphen{}top bounds may be set as a list\sphinxhyphen{}like input. The
first element is the bottom bound; the last element is the
top bound.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{iterations}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The number of iterations this filler will run through to
develop the proper filter.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{final\_filter} \textendash{} The filter as computed by this function.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{mask\_subarray() (in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.geometric)@\spxentry{mask\_subarray()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.masking.geometric}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking.geometric:ifa_smeargle.masking.geometric.mask_subarray}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.masking.geometric.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{mask\_subarray}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{column\_range}, \emph{row\_range}}{}
This applies a mask on the entire array except for a single
sub\sphinxhyphen{}array rectangle.

This function subsets a sub\sphinxhyphen{}array of the data array from a
mask. Only one sub\sphinxhyphen{}array can be defined using this function.
The bounds of the sub\sphinxhyphen{}array is inclusively defined by the
x\sphinxhyphen{}ranges and y\sphinxhyphen{}ranges.

If you want to mask a rectangular section of your array, use
\sphinxtitleref{mask\_rectangle}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The data array that the mask will be calculated from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{column\_range}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The inclusive column bounds of the sub\sphinxhyphen{}array.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{row\_range}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The inclusive row bounds of the sub\sphinxhyphen{}array.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{final\_mask} \textendash{} A boolean array for pixels that are masked (True) or are
valid (False).

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray \sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{} dictionary

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\paragraph{Module contents}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking:module-ifa_smeargle.masking}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.masking:module-contents}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.masking (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.masking}\spxextra{module}}
This covers all of the masking programs, establishing the filters
and how they operate. In general, they are divided by how they
are applied.


\subsubsection{ifa\_smeargle.plotting package}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting:ifa-smeargle-plotting-package}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting::doc}}

\paragraph{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting:submodules}}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.base\_functions module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.base_functions:module-ifa_smeargle.plotting.base_functions}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.base_functions:ifa-smeargle-plotting-base-functions-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.base_functions::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.base\_functions (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.base\_functions}\spxextra{module}}
These are the base functions that are common to the entire plotting
functionality.
\index{create\_directory\_plot\_files() (in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.base\_functions)@\spxentry{create\_directory\_plot\_files()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.base\_functions}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.base_functions:ifa_smeargle.plotting.base_functions.create_directory_plot_files}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.base\_functions.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_directory\_plot\_files}}}{\emph{data\_directory}, \emph{plotting\_function}, \emph{figure\_arguments}, \emph{plot\_arguments}, \emph{matplotlib\_arguments}}{}
This function is the common function to create plots for
all analysis fits files.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The data directory by which all of data for the analysis
is contained within.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{plotting\_function}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{function}}) \textendash{} This is the plotting function that will be applied to all
analysis fits files.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{figure\_arguments}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}) \textendash{} The plotting arguments that will be sent to the function
that creates the function.s

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{plot\_arguments}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}) \textendash{} Custom arguments that shall be given to the plotting
function. For arguments that should be sent to the
matplotlib function, use \sphinxtitleref{matplotlib\_arguments}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{matplotlib\_arguments}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}) \textendash{} Custom arguments that shall be given to the matplotlib
functions. For arguments that should be sent to the
plotting function, use \sphinxtitleref{plot\_arguments}.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
None

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{write\_plot\_file() (in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.base\_functions)@\spxentry{write\_plot\_file()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.base\_functions}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.base_functions:ifa_smeargle.plotting.base_functions.write_plot_file}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.base\_functions.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{write\_plot\_file}}}{\emph{file\_name}, \emph{figure}, \emph{title=None}, \emph{close\_figure=True}}{}
This function just saves a figure to a file to a name
provided.

Because of some oddities with Matplotlib, saving a file within
a function and exiting said function (or overwriting in a loop
its variable) with a new figure causes two figures to be saved
in parallel. This is very memory intensive, so closing a saved
figure is ideal. This function does this by default.

See \sphinxurl{https://stackoverflow.com/a/8862575} and
\sphinxurl{https://cutt.ly/gyK4HlE} for more information.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_name}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} This is the file string name for the figure to be saved. It
should already have the appropriate extension. If not, it
defaults to the configuration default.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{figure}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Matplotlib Figure}}) \textendash{} This is the figure to be saved to a file.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{title}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} This is the title for the figure plot. Although it can be
added from here, it is not advised; the original function
creating the plot should do it instead.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{close\_figure}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} This specifies if the figure should be closed. Given that
this function is built for that, this should not be changed.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode


\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Nothing

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
The file type checking logic is not the smartest implementation.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.heatmap module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.heatmap:module-ifa_smeargle.plotting.heatmap}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.heatmap:ifa-smeargle-plotting-heatmap-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.heatmap::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.heatmap (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.heatmap}\spxextra{module}}
This creates a plot of a heat\sphinxhyphen{}map from analysis fits files.
\index{plot\_heatmap() (in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.heatmap)@\spxentry{plot\_heatmap()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.heatmap}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.heatmap:ifa_smeargle.plotting.heatmap.plot_heatmap}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.heatmap.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_heatmap}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{data\_header=None}, \emph{data\_mask=None}, \emph{figure\_axes=None}, \emph{matplotlib\_arguments=None}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
A function to create a heat\sphinxhyphen{}map image of the data array
provided.

This function replicates the image plotting functionality of
Tino Well’s program. (Found here:
\sphinxurl{https://github.com/tinowells/ifa}). More specifically, the plot
assigns a color according to the value a pixel has, and plots
it corresponding to its location in the provided data array.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} This is the provided array that is to be plotted.
Dimensions matter!

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_header}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Astropy Header}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} This is the data header of the fits file. If it is not
provided, plotting parameters which use it will not be plot.
An error may also be raised.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_mask}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The mask that should be applied to the \sphinxtitleref{data\_array}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{figure\_axes}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Matplotlib Axes}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} This is a predefined axes variable that the user may desire
to have the heat\sphinxhyphen{}map plot to. This defaults to either making
new ones, or using the currently defined axes. Note: This
is not deep\sphinxhyphen{}copied!

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{matplotlib\_arguments}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} These are options the user may use to pass customization
parameters into the heat\sphinxhyphen{}map plot or the color\sphinxhyphen{}bar
functionalities.
See \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{imshow()}} and
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{colorbar()}}.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{heatmap\_plot\_axes} \textendash{} This is the heatmap plot made on the (provided, borrowed, or
generated) plotting axes.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Matplotlib Axes

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{script\_plot\_heatmap() (in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.heatmap)@\spxentry{script\_plot\_heatmap()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.heatmap}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.heatmap:ifa_smeargle.plotting.heatmap.script_plot_heatmap}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.heatmap.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{script\_plot\_heatmap}}}{\emph{config}}{}
The scripting version of \sphinxtitleref{plot\_heatmap}. This function
automatically creates heat\sphinxhyphen{}map plots for each and every analysis
data file.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{config}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ConfigObj}}) \textendash{} The configuration object that is to be used for this
function.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}



\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.histogram module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.histogram:module-ifa_smeargle.plotting.histogram}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.histogram:ifa-smeargle-plotting-histogram-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.histogram::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.histogram (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.histogram}\spxextra{module}}
This is the function for plotting the histogram and Gaussian fits.
\index{plot\_gaussian\_histogram() (in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.histogram)@\spxentry{plot\_gaussian\_histogram()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.plotting.histogram}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.plotting.histogram:ifa_smeargle.plotting.histogram.plot_gaussian_histogram}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.plotting.histogram.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_gaussian\_histogram}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{data\_header=None}, \emph{data\_mask=None}, \emph{figure\_axes=None}, \emph{matplotlib\_arguments=None}, \emph{fit\_gaussian=True}, \emph{**kwargs}}{}
A function to create and plot histogram plots for better
analysis of a given array.

This function replicates the histogram plotting functionality
of Tino Well’s program.
(Found here: \sphinxurl{https://github.com/tinowells/ifa}). More
specifically, it attempts to plot histograms of pixel data; then,
the program attempts to fit a Gaussian function.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} This is the provided array that is to be plotted.
Dimensions matter!

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_header}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Astropy Header}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} This is the data header of the fits file. If it is not
provided, plotting parameters which use it will not be plot.
An error may also be raised.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_mask}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The mask that should be applied to the \sphinxtitleref{data\_array}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{figure\_axes}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Matplotlib Axes}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} This is a predefined axes variable that the user may desire
to have the heat\sphinxhyphen{}map plot to. This defaults to either making
new ones, or using the currently defined axes. Note: This
is not deep\sphinxhyphen{}copied!

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{matplotlib\_arguments}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dictionary}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} These are options the user may use to pass customization
parameters into the histogram plot or the Gaussian function
plot.
See \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bar()}} and
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{plot()}}.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{heatmap\_plot\_axes} \textendash{} This is the heatmap plot made on the (provided, borrowed, or
generated) plotting axes.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Matplotlib Axes

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse:module-ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse:ifa-smeargle-reformat-collapse-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse}\spxextra{module}}
This contains the functions required for making effective collapsed
frames; usually by extracting and subtracting subsets of frames and
normalizing over some time.
\index{collapse\_by\_average\_endpoints() (in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse)@\spxentry{collapse\_by\_average\_endpoints()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse:ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse.collapse_by_average_endpoints}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{collapse\_by\_average\_endpoints}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{start\_chunk}, \emph{end\_chunk}, \emph{average\_method=\textquotesingle{}median\textquotesingle{}}, \emph{frame\_exposure\_time=None}}{}
This function reads a fits file and computes its end section
values.

This function reads in a fits file of 3 dimensions, averaging
some top chunk and bottom chunk of their “temporal” axis.

If there is no temporal axis, this program raises an error.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The data array that the average will be taken from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{start\_chunk}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\sphinxhyphen{}like}}) \textendash{} The exact range of frames from the beginning that will be
averaged as per the averaging method.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{end\_chunk}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\sphinxhyphen{}like}}) \textendash{} The exact range of frames from the end that will be averaged
as per the averaging method.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{average\_method}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} 
The current available methods for determining the file size
that is proper. Defaults to median:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’mean’}] \leavevmode
This takes the mean along the frames of each
chunk

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’median’}] \leavevmode
This takes the median along the frames of
each chunk. Even sets use the mean of the
middle most two values.

\end{description}

\end{itemize}


\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{frame\_exposure\_time}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The duration, per frame (in seconds), of each exposure.
This is really not used in this function, but, it is added
for uniformity with the other functions.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{final\_data} \textendash{} The final data array of the median\sphinxhyphen{}ed frames as desired.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
ndarray

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{collapse\_by\_average\_endpoints\_per\_kilosecond() (in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse)@\spxentry{collapse\_by\_average\_endpoints\_per\_kilosecond()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse:ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse.collapse_by_average_endpoints_per_kilosecond}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{collapse\_by\_average\_endpoints\_per\_kilosecond}}}{\emph{data\_array}, \emph{start\_chunk}, \emph{end\_chunk}, \emph{frame\_exposure\_time}, \emph{average\_method=\textquotesingle{}median\textquotesingle{}}}{}
This function reads a fits file and computes its end section
values, normalizing per kilosecond.

This function reads in a fits file of 3 dimensions, averaging
some top chunk and bottom chunk of their “temporal” axis,
normalizing and dividing over a timespan. The time is measured
in kiloseconds. This is basically a wrapper function around the
per second version.

If there is no temporal axis, this program raises an error.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_array}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ndarray}}) \textendash{} The data array that the average will be taken from.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{start\_chunk}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\sphinxhyphen{}like}}) \textendash{} The exact range of frames from the beginning that will be
averaged as per the averaging method.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{end\_chunk}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\sphinxhyphen{}like}}) \textendash{} The exact range of frames from the end that will be averaged
as per the averaging method.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{frame\_exposure\_time}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} The duration, per frame (in seconds), of each exposure.
This is really not used in this function, but, it is added
for uniformity with the other functions.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{average\_method}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} 
The current available methods for determining the file size
that is proper. Defaults to median.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’mean’}] \leavevmode
This takes the mean along the frames of each
chunk

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’median’}] \leavevmode
This takes the median along the frames of
each chunk. Even sets use the mean of the
middle most two values.

\end{description}

\end{itemize}


\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
