\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse:ifa_smeargle.reformat.collapse.script_collapse_by_average_endpoints_per_second}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.collapse.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{script\_collapse\_by\_average\_endpoints\_per\_second}}}{\emph{config}}{}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.renaming module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.renaming:module-ifa_smeargle.reformat.renaming}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.renaming:ifa-smeargle-reformat-renaming-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.renaming::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.renaming (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.renaming}\spxextra{module}}
This file contains methods used to determine proper naming
conventions and to reformat the fits file names from raw output
(often just timestamps) to something more useful and accurate to the
data.
\index{rename\_detector() (in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.renaming)@\spxentry{rename\_detector()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.renaming}}

be renamed.

\item {}

the string version.

determined by the number of files in a set. Sets are assumed

\end{itemize}

\index{rename\_voltage\_pattern() (in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.renaming)@\spxentry{rename\_voltage\_pattern()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.renaming}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.renaming:ifa_smeargle.reformat.renaming.rename_voltage_pattern}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.renaming.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{rename\_voltage\_pattern}}}{\emph{data\_directory}, \emph{voltage\_pattern}, \emph{begin\_garbage=0}}{}
Creates file tags according to their voltage pattern
specified.

Some data filename outputs only give timestamps. This function
renames said filenames for better processing.

The output files created are according to the voltage pattern
that the user specified. This function assumes that the pattern
provided is one ‘set’, where a set contains some amount of fits
files. Moreover, this function weakly determines which are
up\sphinxhyphen{}mid\sphinxhyphen{}down ramps.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} This is the directory that contain all of the data files
to be renamed.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{voltage\_pattern}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\_like}}) \textendash{} These are voltage values, assuming that the first element
is the first voltage element to be used, proceeding from
there in order.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{begin\_garbage}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The number of files, in the beginning, that should not count
as data.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{voltage\_string\_list} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{list}) \textendash{} This is the list of the voltage strings applied, given in
a parallel ordered form. Does not include prefixes/suffixes.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{voltage\_raw\_list} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{dictionary}) \textendash{} This is the raw, unformatted values that was formatted
into the string version. The voltage values and trends are
separated (as \sphinxtitleref{value} and \sphinxtitleref{trend}).

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.sanitization module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.sanitization:module-ifa_smeargle.reformat.sanitization}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.sanitization:ifa-smeargle-reformat-sanitization-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.sanitization::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.sanitization (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.sanitization}\spxextra{module}}\index{sanitize\_file\_size() (in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.sanitization)@\spxentry{sanitize\_file\_size()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.sanitization}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.sanitization:ifa_smeargle.reformat.sanitization.sanitize_file_size}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.sanitization.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sanitize\_file\_size}}}{\emph{data\_directory}, \emph{method=\textquotesingle{}largest\textquotesingle{}}, \emph{delete=False}, \emph{exact\_size=None}}{}
A function to clean the data directory of any file
abnormalities stemming from incomplete or over\sphinxhyphen{}complete files.

It is often to have too large files or too small files in a data
set. These files hold no consequence for removal and would only
contaminate or crash the pipeline if they went through. The
good files are kept, and the bad files are deleted. This method
only affects \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.fits}} files.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_directory}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The directory of the data that is to be sanitized with the
non\sphinxhyphen{}conforming files deleted.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{method}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} 
The current available methods for determining the file size
that is proper.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’largest’}] \leavevmode
The largest \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.fits}} file is considered
to be the right file size (default).

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’smallest’}] \leavevmode
The smallest \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.fits}} file is considered
to be the right file size.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’exact’}] \leavevmode
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{.fits}} file that is exactly the
size specified.

\end{description}

\end{itemize}


\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{delete}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} If True, then all bad files found by this method are deleted.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{exact\_size}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The exact size a proper file size should be (unit is in
bytes). Only applied if the method used is \sphinxtitleref{exact}

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{bad\_file\_list} \textendash{} The list of all of the file names/paths that are flagged for
sanitization.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{script\_sanitize\_file\_size() (in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.sanitization)@\spxentry{script\_sanitize\_file\_size()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.reformat.sanitization}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.reformat.sanitization:ifa_smeargle.reformat.sanitization.script_sanitize_file_size}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.reformat.sanitization.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{script\_sanitize\_file\_size}}}{\emph{config}}{}
The scripting version of \sphinxtitleref{sanitize\_file\_size}. This function
sanitizes the documents as prescribed by the configuration and
the inner function.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{config}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ConfigObj}}) \textendash{} The configuration object that is to be used for this
function.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode

\end{description}\end{quote}

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.testing.test\_numerical\_filters module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.testing.test_numerical_filters:module-ifa_smeargle.testing.test_numerical_filters}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.testing.test_numerical_filters:ifa-smeargle-testing-test-numerical-filters-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.testing.test_numerical_filters::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.testing.test\_numerical\_filters (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.testing.test\_numerical\_filters}\spxextra{module}}
This tests the filter functions to ensure that they are
appropriately calculating the filters as expected.

These filter tests operate on the principle that the product of
single power prime integers is always unique, and by extension,
so are their logarithms. Prime number arrays are filtered,
multiplied together, and compared against an expected hard\sphinxhyphen{}coded
result.
\index{test\_filter\_exact\_value() (in module ifa\_smeargle.testing.test\_numerical\_filters)@\spxentry{test\_filter\_exact\_value()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.testing.test\_numerical\_filters}}

\end{fulllineitems}

appropriately calculating the masks as expected.

These mask tests operate on the principle that the product of single

together, and compared against an expected hard\sphinxhyphen{}coded result.

\subparagraph{ifa\_smeargle.tutorial.generation module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.tutorial.generation:module-ifa_smeargle.tutorial.generation}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.tutorial.generation:ifa-smeargle-tutorial-generation-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.tutorial.generation::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.tutorial.generation (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.tutorial.generation}\spxextra{module}}
These functions generates all of the required tutorial data,
configurations, and other needed objects to begin or run through
the tutorial.
\index{tutorial\_generate\_fits\_file() (in module ifa\_smeargle.tutorial.generation)@\spxentry{tutorial\_generate\_fits\_file()}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.tutorial.generation}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.tutorial.generation:ifa_smeargle.tutorial.generation.tutorial_generate_fits_file}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.tutorial.generation.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{tutorial\_generate\_fits\_file}}}{\emph{generation\_mode}, \emph{data\_shape}, \emph{fill\_value=None}, \emph{seed=None}, \emph{range=None}}{}
This function generates a fits file that emulate
the real data in some regards. The different modes can create
different data representations.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{generation\_mode}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} 
The generation mode that the data will adhere to.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’fill’}] \leavevmode
The fits data values are some constant number.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’increment’}] \leavevmode
The files data values are created by counting
up individually. Order is based on C indexing.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’pseudorandom’}] \leavevmode
The fits data values are generated using
a set seed and a pseudorandom number generator.

\end{description}

\item {} \begin{description}
\item[{’random’}] \leavevmode
The fits data values are generated randomly
as determined by undetermined\sphinxhyphen{}seed random number
generator.

\end{description}

\end{itemize}


\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{data\_shape}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}) \textendash{} The shape of the data that will be created.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fill\_value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The value that fills the data array. Only used if
the generation mode is \sphinxtitleref{fill}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{seed}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The seed value for the pseudorandom number generator. Only
used if the generation mode is \sphinxtitleref{pseudorandom}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{range}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{array\sphinxhyphen{}like}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ (}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{)}}) \textendash{} The range for the pseudorandom and the random number
generator. It takes only the highest and lowest numbers in
the tuple as the appropriate range. The range is {[}min, max).
Defaults to {[}0.0, 1.0).

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{hdu\_object} \textendash{} An object representation of the fits file. The header is
also generated.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
Astropy HDU object

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.tutorial.scripting:module-ifa_smeargle.tutorial.scripting}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.tutorial.scripting:ifa-smeargle-tutorial-scripting-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.tutorial.scripting::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.tutorial.scripting (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.tutorial.scripting}\spxextra{module}}

\subsection{Submodules}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle:submodules}}

\subsubsection{ifa\_smeargle.runtime module}
\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.runtime:module-ifa_smeargle.runtime}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.runtime:ifa-smeargle-runtime-module}}\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.runtime::doc}}\index{ifa\_smeargle.runtime (module)@\spxentry{ifa\_smeargle.runtime}\spxextra{module}}
This module contains runtime\sphinxhyphen{}variables that are important for the
function of this module.
\index{extract\_runtime\_configuration (in module ifa\_smeargle.runtime)@\spxentry{extract\_runtime\_configuration}\spxextra{in module ifa\_smeargle.runtime}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{docstrings/ifa_smeargle.runtime:ifa_smeargle.runtime.extract_runtime_configuration}}\pysigline{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ifa\_smeargle.runtime.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{extract\_runtime\_configuration}}}
This function extracts the configuration based solely on the
key of the configuration value.

The conversion of ‘True’\sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}bool(True) and ‘False’\sphinxhyphen{}\textgreater{}bool(False) is
implicitly assumed. Letter case doesn’t matter.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{config\_key}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{string}}) \textendash{} The tag of the configuration parameter that is being sought.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{type\_convert}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{boolean}}) \textendash{} A flag to determine if type conversion is desired. If False,
the raw value is returned instead.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstylestrong{config\_value} \textendash{} The configuration object that is present within the file.
